Articles.Content:
The Messerschmitt Me 163 Komet was a German rocket-powered fighter aircraft. It is the only rocket-powered fighter aircraft ever to have been operational. Its design was revolutionary, and the Me 163 was capable of performance unrivaled at the time. In tests it reached 1,130 km/h (700 mph), not broken in terms of absolute speed until November 1947. Over 300 aircraft were built; the Komet proved ineffective as a fighter, having been responsible for the destruction of only about nine Allied aircraft.

So I have "tried" to recreate one of the most known German aircrafts of World War II. Like the real Me 163, it has a revolutionary "no tail" design with a rocket engine powered fuselage, and a skid landing gear.

Download: http://www./view/6av33kd2ccelucw/Me-163_B.craft

Nice build of the not so successful fighter . It was interesting boom and zoom fighter though...in my opinion.

nice work.

The Komet is a really cool plane, I'm glad you got around to making it in KSP. You did a great job!

Rep for you.
